slides.title: How Search Engines Work
slides.content:
# How Search Engines Work ü§ñ

## The Three Steps:
```
Crawling ‚Üí Indexing ‚Üí Ranking
   ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ          ‚îÇ
   ‚ñº          ‚ñº          ‚ñº
Discover   Store     Display
 pages     pages     results

## Crawling:
- Bots follow links
- Discover new pages

## Indexing:
- Store page content
- Analyze meaning
- Understand relationships

## Ranking:
- Match to search queries
- Order by relevance
- Consider 200+ factors

| Factor | Impact |

slides.title: On-Page SEO
slides.content:
# On-Page SEO üìù Optimize individual page content. ## Title Tags: ```html Best Coffee Shops in NYC | CoffeeGuide ``` - 50-60 characters - Primary keyword first - Brand at end ## Meta Description: ```html ``` - 150-160 characters - Include keywords naturally - Call to action ## Headings: ```html

Best Coffee Shops in NYC

Downtown Manhattan

Blue Bottle Coffee

``` ## Content: - Unique, valuable content - Natural keyword usage - Answer user intent - 1500+ words for competitive topics

slides.title: Keywords
slides.content:
# Keyword Research üîë

Find what people search for.

## Types of Keywords:
| Type | Example | Competition |
|------|---------|-------------|
| Head | "coffee" | Very High |
| Body | "coffee shops" | High |
| Long-tail | "best coffee shops NYC" | Lower |

## Research Tools:
- Google Keyword Planner
- Ahrefs / SEMrush
- Google Trends
- Answer The Public

## Search Intent:
```
Informational: "how to make coffee"
Navigational: "starbucks near me"
Transactional: "buy coffee beans online"
Commercial: "best coffee makers 2024"
```

## Placement:
- Title tag
- H1 heading
- First paragraph
- URL
- Image alt text
- Throughout content naturally

> Avoid keyword stuffing!

slides.title: URL Structure
slides.content:
# URL Structure üîó

SEO-friendly URLs.

## Good vs Bad:
```
‚ùå example.com/p?id=123
‚ùå example.com/2024/01/15/post-title-here-12345

‚úÖ example.com/coffee-shops-nyc
‚úÖ example.com/blog/best-coffee-beans
```

## Best Practices:
- ‚úÖ Use hyphens (not underscores)
- ‚úÖ Lowercase only
- ‚úÖ Include target keyword
- ‚úÖ Keep short and descriptive
- ‚úÖ Avoid special characters
- ‚ùå No dates (unless news)
- ‚ùå No session IDs

## URL Structure:
```
example.com/category/subcategory/page-name
example.com/products/coffee/espresso
```

## Canonical URLs:
```html
<link rel="canonical" href="https://example.com/page">
```
Prevents duplicate content issues.

slides.title: Internal Linking
slides.content: # Internal Linking üîó Connect your pages strategically. ## Benefits: - Helps crawlers discover pages - Distributes page authority - Improves user navigation - Reduces bounce rate ## Best Practices: ```html guide to espresso click here ``` ## Strategy: ``` Homepage ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Category Pages ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Product Pages ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Blog ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Related Posts ``` ## Tips: - Link from high-authority pages - Use relevant anchor text - Link to important pages often - Create content clusters

slides.title: Site Speed
slides.content: # Site Speed ‚ö° Page speed is a ranking factor. ## Core Web Vitals: | Metric | Target | |--------|--------| | LCP | < 2.5s | | FID/INP | < 100ms | | CLS | < 0.1 | ## Optimization: ```html ``` ## Quick Wins: - Compress images (WebP) - Enable caching - Use CDN - Minify CSS/JS - Reduce redirects ## Tools: - Google PageSpeed Insights - Lighthouse - GTmetrix - WebPageTest

slides.title: Mobile SEO
slides.content:
# Mobile-First SEO üì±

Google uses mobile-first indexing.

## Mobile-First Means:
- Google primarily uses mobile version
- Mobile site must have same content
- Mobile experience is critical

## Responsive Design:
```html
<meta name="viewport" 
    content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
```

```css
@media (max-width: 768px) {
    .container {
        width: 100%;
        padding: 15px;
    }
}
```

## Mobile Checklist:
- [ ] Text readable without zooming
- [ ] Tap targets large enough (48px)
- [ ] No horizontal scrolling
- [ ] Fast loading on 3G
- [ ] No intrusive interstitials

## Test:
- Google Mobile-Friendly Test
- Chrome DevTools Device Mode

slides.title: Image SEO
slides.content: # Image SEO üñºÔ∏è Optimize images for search. ## File Names: ``` ‚ùå IMG_12345.jpg ‚úÖ espresso-coffee-beans.jpg ``` ## Alt Text: ```html ``` ## Optimization: | Format | Use Case | |--------|----------| | JPEG | Photos | | PNG | Transparency | | WebP | Modern browsers | | SVG | Icons, logos | ## Responsive Images: ```html ``` ## Image Sitemaps: Submit images to Google via sitemap.

slides.title: Content Quality
slides.content:
# Content Quality üìÑ

Content is king for SEO.

## E-E-A-T:
- **Experience** - First-hand knowledge
- **Expertise** - Subject matter authority
- **Authoritativeness** - Industry recognition
- **Trustworthiness** - Accuracy and safety

## Quality Signals:
- Original research/insights
- Comprehensive coverage
- Well-organized structure
- Updated regularly
- No spelling/grammar errors

## Content Audit:
- [ ] Does it answer search intent?
- [ ] Is it better than competitors?
- [ ] Does it provide unique value?
- [ ] Is it current and accurate?
- [ ] Does it have clear structure?

## Avoid:
- Thin content (< 300 words)
- Duplicate content
- Keyword stuffing
- AI-generated without value

slides.title: Technical SEO
slides.content:
# Technical SEO ‚öôÔ∏è

Help search engines crawl your site.

## robots.txt:
```
User-agent: *
Allow: /
Disallow: /admin/
Disallow: /private/

Sitemap: https://example.com/sitemap.xml
```

## Sitemap:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<urlset xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9">
    <url>
        <loc>https://example.com/</loc>
        <lastmod>2024-01-15</lastmod>
        <priority>1.0</priority>
    </url>
</urlset>
```

## HTTPS:
- Required for ranking
- Security signal
- User trust

## Structured Data:
```html
<script type="application/ld+json">
{
    "@context": "https://schema.org",
    "@type": "Article",
    "headline": "Best Coffee Shops"
}
</script>
```
